alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 9:57PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Dallas, Laclede and Webster. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - This includes the following low water crossings... Niangua River at Highway Y, North Cobb Creek at Ripley Drive, Cabin Creek at Cabin Creek Road, Dry Auglaize Creek at Highway BB, Bear Creek at Highway FF, Givins Branch at Highway W and Osage Fork at Auburn Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, Marshfield, Richland, Conway, Niangua, Morgan, Phillipsburg, Stoutland, Twin Bridges, Long Lane, Rader, Charity, Sleeper, Elkland, Olive and Bennett Spring State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
